title: Of the imitation of Christ, three, both for wisedome, and godlines, most excellent bookes; made 170. yeeres since by one Thomas of Kempis, and for the worthines thereof oft since translated out of Latine into sundrie languages by diuers godlie and learned men: now newlie corrected, translated, and with most ample textes, and sentences of holie Scripture illustrated by Thomas Rogers
author: Rogers, Thomas, d. 1616.
publisher: By Henrie Denham, dwelling in Pater noster Row, at the signe of the Starre,
notes: The traditional attribution to Thomas à Kempis is disputed.
At foot of title: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.
Colophon reads: 1580. Imprinted at London by Henry Denham .. being the assigne of William Seres.
The first leaf bears a woodcut (repeated on B12v).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
